academic-paper.page-body:
Websites

Example user: Profesional photographer.

Webs pages are traditionally the standard mechanism for publishing on the web. A collection of these pages will for a website. (Lloyd, 2008).

An example user of a traditional web page may be a professional photographer to wants to create a portfolio of their work to attract customers or commissioned work.

He could maybe consider utilising the API of an online photo publishing website such as Flickr to integrate his photos professionally into his website.

Websites are suited for when you want a professional feel to your online presence and as such are typically preferable over publishing on social networks, more for social interaction than formal presentation,
or micro blogging services, which is only designed for short publication. Blogs are typically combined within a professional website rather than used on their own.
